Package com.evanv.taskapp.logic

Class LogicSubsystem

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.evanv.taskapp.logic.LogicSubsystem
  • public class LogicSubsystem
extends java.lang.Object
    The subsystem that handles the logic for the app. All items/references are worked with here. Singleton so information can be found everywhere without constant use of ever-increasingly complex Intents.
    Author:
    Evan Voogd

    • Constructor Detail

      • LogicSubsystem

        public LogicSubsystem​(MainActivity mainActivity,
                      int todayTime,
                      long timedTaskID,
                      long timerStart)
        Creates a new LogicSubsystem and loads data from database into internal data structures. Only call once.
        Parameters:
        mainActivity - The calling MainActivity. Don't love this from a coupling perspective, but due to Android's design, it's necessary to extract resources.
        todayTime - The amount of time spent completing tasks so far today.
        timedTaskID - ID of the task currently being timed.
        timerStart - Start time of the current timer.

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static LogicSubsystem getInstance()
        Return the singleton instance of the LogicSubsystem. Contains all data structures for the app.
        Returns:
        The singleton instance of the LogicSubsystem

      • getOverdueTasks

        public java.lang.String[] getOverdueTasks​(Context context)
                                   throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Gets a list of overdue tasks. Only works in the beginning of the app lifecycle, else returns null. This is due to the fact that all overdue tasks need to be handled for the app to begin operation.
        Parameters:
        context - Give context for resources
        Returns:
        Return list of currently unhandled overdue tasks.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException

      • getNumFailures

        public int getNumFailures()
        Get the number of tasks that were corrupted.
        Returns:
        number of corrupted tasks

      • updateOverdueTasks

        public void updateOverdueTasks​(java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> completedItems,
                               Context context)
        Handle user input on overdue tasks - mark tasks as either completed, or to be completed today.
        Parameters:
        completedItems - Indices into the overdue task names array that the user marked as completed.
        context - Context for resources

      • prepForDisplay

        public java.util.List<DayItem> prepForDisplay​(boolean reoptimize,
                                              Context context)
        Overdue tasks have been handled, so now we're ready to start the app. Load events from internal database and optimize if necessary.
        Parameters:
        reoptimize - If there was overdue tasks, reoptimize to account for them.
        context - Context for resources
        Returns:
        A list of DayItems to be used by MainActivity's recycler.

      • Complete

        public java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> Complete​(Task task,
                                                  Context context)
        Removes a task from the task dependency graph.
        Parameters:
        task - The task to be removed from the task dependency graph
        context - Context for resources
        Returns:
        List of days changed.

      • addTodayTime

        public void addTodayTime​(int timeToAdd)
        Add time to current amount of time spent completing tasks.
        Parameters:
        timeToAdd - Amount of time to add.

      • isEmpty

        public boolean isEmpty()
        Return true if the app has no tasks/events currently being tracked.
        Returns:
        true if app's internal data structures are empty.

      • Optimize

        public void Optimize()
        Optimize the user's schedules. Returns a list of pairs representing tasks that were changed - specifically their formerly scheduled index and their newly scheduled index, so all these indices must be updated.

      • updateTasks

        private void updateTasks​(java.util.List<Task> changedTasks)
        Update the task data structures based on Optimizer's output. Returns a list of pairs representing the tasks that have been changed - specifically their formerly scheduled index and their newly scheduled index, so all these indices must be updated.
        Parameters:
        changedTasks - List of tasks that have been changed.

      • pareDownSchedules

        private void pareDownSchedules()
        Pare down empty dates in the data structures so there's no extra items in the recycler

      • DayItemList

        public java.util.List<DayItem> DayItemList​(Context context)
        Builds a DayItem List representation of a user's tasks/events
        Parameters:
        context - Context for resources
        Returns:
        a DayItem List representation of a user's tasks/events

      • DayItemHelper

        public DayItem DayItemHelper​(int i,
                             Context context)
        Get the EventItem and TaskItem lists for the day i days past today's date. Is used as a helper function so when the recycler needs to be refreshed, it only needs to get the DayItem for the updated days, not the entire schedule.
        Parameters:
        i - How many days past today's date to get the schedule for
        context - Context for resources
        Returns:
        A DayItem representing that day's schedule

      • EventItemList

        private java.util.List<EventItem> EventItemList​(int index)
        Builds an EventItem List representation of a user's events on a given day
        Parameters:
        index - The index into the data structure representing the day
        Returns:
        an EventItem List representation of a user's events on a given day

        public void onButtonClick​(int position,
                          int day,
                          int action,
                          Context context)
        Handle button clicks in the MainActivity by deleting tasks/events.
        Parameters:
        position - Position in given day of event/task
        day - How many days past today's date task/event was scheduled for
        action - 0 to complete task, 1 to delete task, 2 to delete event
        context - Context for resources

      • filter

        public java.util.List<TaskItem> filter​(org.threeten.bp.LocalDate startDate,
                                       org.threeten.bp.LocalDate endDate,
                                       long project,
                                       java.lang.String name,
                                       int minTime,
                                       int maxTime,
                                       boolean completable,
                                       java.util.List<java.lang.Long> labels,
                                       int priority,
                                       Context context)
        Build a list of tasks that meet the given filters. Leave field null or -1 if not needed.
        Parameters:
        startDate - Earliest due date
        endDate - Latest due date
        project - Project ID to show
        name - Name to search for
        minTime - Minimum TTC to show
        maxTime - Maximum TTC
        completable - Show only completable tasks
        context - Context for resources
        Returns:
        A TaskItem list with these parameters.

      • editEvent

        public void editEvent​(java.lang.String name,
                      org.threeten.bp.LocalDateTime start,
                      org.threeten.bp.LocalDateTime end,
                      Bundle recur,
                      long id,
                      Context context)
        Create an event based on the given parameters, and update an existing event if necessary.
        Parameters:
        name - Name of the new event
        start - Start time of the new event
        end - End time of the new event
        recur - Recurrence information of the new event
        id - ID of the event if it needs to be updated, -1 otherwise.
        context - Context for resources.

      • editTask

        public void editTask​(java.lang.String name,
                     org.threeten.bp.LocalDate early,
                     org.threeten.bp.LocalDate due,
                     Bundle recur,
                     int timeToComplete,
                     long project,
                     java.lang.Long[] labelIDs,
                     java.util.List<java.lang.Long> parents,
                     int priority,
                     long id,
                     Context context)
        Create a task based on the given parameters, and update it if necessary
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the Task
        early - The earliest completion date of the task
        due - The due date of the Task
        recur - The Bundle of recurrence information of the task
        timeToComplete - How long the task takes to complete
        project - The index of the selected project (0 if no project was selected)
        labelIDs - An array of Labels that the user has attached to the task
        parents - An array of indices of parents of the added task
        priority - The priority of the task
        id - the ID of the task if it is to be updated, -1 otherwise
        context - Context for resources

                       int color,
                       java.lang.String goal)

        Parameters:
        name - Name of the project
        color - Color of the project

      • convertDay

        public kotlin.Pair<java.lang.Integer,​java.lang.Integer> convertDay​(long ID)
        Get position/day based off of a task's ID
        Parameters:
        ID - the ID of the task
        Returns:
        a pair where the first item is the position of the task and second is the day.

      • postponeTask

        public void postponeTask​(int position,
                         int day)
        Postpone the task at the given position in the task schedule
        Parameters:
        position - Position of this task in the day'th entry of the task schedule
        day - How many days past today the postponed task is scheduled to be completed
